1. Executive Summary



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:

- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1 Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP, Risk and Process Safety Management Program



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 



Process Name               | Process Chemical              | Process Quantity(lbs.)

Ammonia Refrigeration        Anhydrous Ammonia               56,000



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses and physical property damage.



Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 

1. Prepared

a unified program based on the PSM plan to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices

3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

The flooded system operates as follows: high pressure liquid from the high pressure receiver is piped to each cold room, where it passes through an expansion valve into low temperature and pressure accumulator mounted behind the bunker wall. From the accumulators, low pressure liquid is circulated through evaporator coils. As heat is absorbed, the liquid ammonia vaporizes to form low temperature and pressure gas which is returned to the accumulator vessels. The suction gas is returned from the accumulators through a suction return line to the main suction accumulator.  From the main suction accumulator, ammonia is piped to the suction inlet on the compressors. The high pressure discharge from the compressors is sent to water-cooled evaporative condensers where the high pressure gas ammonia is cooled, liquefied and returned to the thermosyphon vessel and then to the high pressure receiver.



The system contains numerous safety devices including sensors which stop the compressors if temperatures or pressures exceed or drop below established limits, and pressure relief valves which vent to the ammonia diffusion tanks if the pressure in the system exceeds their set point. 



There is one ammonia detector installed inside the refriger

ation machinery room. The sensor is set at the California OSHA permissible exposure limit of 25 ppm, which will activate an audible alarm and strobe. Also, two separate sampling systems are installed monitoring each refrigerated room,  providing at least every fifteen-minute interval monitoring. The sampling system is set at the California OSHA permissible exposure limit of 25 ppm, which will activate an audible alarm and strobe.



An emergency control box is installed on the north side of the refrigeration machinery room, which contains three valves. The high and low side of the system each have a valve that would discharge to the diffusion tanks. The connecting pipe between the high and low side has one equalizer valve that would equalize the system.



The ammonia refrigeration system at Grapeman (Lucich Farms) Bakersfield consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping.  As such, the refrigeration system at Grapeman (Lucich Farms) Bakersfield is treated as a single process.



1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps



1.3.1 General 



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders.

 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia



The ammonia refrigeration process at the Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and eff

icient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.



Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active logbook of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment.



1.4 Five Year Accident History

Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP does not have an incident in the past 5 years that is  to be identified in the 5-year Accident History.



1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan



Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:

- California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

- Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38 

- California "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 8 CCR Title 8 ?5192(q)

- Federal "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 29 CFR ?1910.120(q)



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the 

RMP-PSM program. This has improved Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP's management team can ensure

that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.



In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.



For the future, Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a 

"living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Grapeman Bakersfield Cold Storage LP will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
